trans-unit.source: Question 1: Is this the right approach? Other developers could have easily worked on same files as I have worked btw.
trans-unit.target: 问题1：这是正确的方法吗？其他开发人员可以像我一样轻松地处理相同的文件。

trans-unit.source: Question 2: Which one of these two methods is right? What is the difference there?
trans-unit.target: 问题2：这两种方法中哪一种是正确的？有什么区别？

trans-unit.source: @KingCrunch's answer should work in many cases. One issue that can arise is you may be on a different machine that needs to pull the latest from test. So, I recommend pulling test first. The revision looks like this:
trans-unit.target: @KingCrunch的回答应该在很多情况下都可以。可能出现的一个问题是你可能在不同的机器上,需要从测试中拉出最新的。所以,我建议先拉测试。修订后的版本看起来是这样的。

trans-unit.source: A new branch from master is created, we call it test.
trans-unit.target: 从 master 创建了一个新分支，我们称之为 test 。

trans-unit.source: A) Create a PR (e.g. on GitHub) and merge it there via the UI
trans-unit.target: A)创建一个PR(例如在GitHub上),并通过用户界面将其合并到那里。

trans-unit.source: After merging, if the file is changed, then when you merge it will through error of "Resolve Conflict"
trans-unit.target: 合并后,如果文件发生了变化,那么在合并时就会出现 "解决冲突 "的错误。

trans-unit.source: After the merge of the pull request, you can delete it locally:
trans-unit.target: 拉动请求合并后,可以在本地删除。

trans-unit.source: As the title says "Best way", I think it's a good idea to consider the patience merge strategy.
trans-unit.target: 正如标题中所说的“最佳方式”一样，我认为考虑耐心合并策略是一个好主意 。

trans-unit.source: B) Go back on the command line and merge the branch into master
trans-unit.target: B)回到命令行,并将分支合并到master中。

trans-unit.source: Besides KingCrunches answer, I suggest to use
trans-unit.target: 除了KingCrunches答案，我建议使用

trans-unit.source: But this way will lose the changes history logged in test branch, and it would make master branch to be hard for other developers to understand the history of the project.
trans-unit.target: 但这种方式会失去测试分支中记录的更改历史记录,会让主分支很难让其他开发人员了解项目的历史记录。

trans-unit.target: https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/merging-vs-rebasing/the-golden-rule-of-rebasing的详细信息

trans-unit.source: Following is one simple sample, for advanced operations, please refer to http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Branching-Rebasing
trans-unit.target: 以下是一个简单的示例，有关高级操作，请参阅http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Branching-Rebasing

trans-unit.source: From: https://git-scm.com/docs/merge-strategies

trans-unit.source: Get the latest from origin
trans-unit.target: 获取最新的原产地信息

trans-unit.source: Git Alias
trans-unit.target: Git别名

trans-unit.source: How I would do this
trans-unit.target: 我会怎么做

trans-unit.source: How to Rebase a Pull Request
trans-unit.target: 如何重订一个拉动请求

trans-unit.source: I am not using --rebase because from my understanding, rebase will get the changes from master and stack mine on top of that hence it could overwrite changes other people made.
trans-unit.target: 我不使用 --rebase ,因为据我所知，rebase将获得 master 的更改并在此基础上进行栈式更改，因此它可能会覆盖其他人所做的更改。

trans-unit.source: I use always an alias for this, e.g. run once:
trans-unit.target: 对此,我总是用一个别名,比如说跑一次。

trans-unit.source: I would do git pull origin master from test.
trans-unit.target: 我会做 git pull origin master 从 test 。

trans-unit.source: I would first make the to-be-merged branch as clean as possible. Run your tests, make sure the state is as you want it. Clean up the new commits by git squash.
trans-unit.target: 我首先要使要合并的分支尽可能干净。运行测试，确保状态为所需状态。通过git squash清理新提交。

trans-unit.source: I would use the rebase method. Mostly because it perfectly reflects your case semantically, ie. what you want to do is to refresh the state of your current branch and "pretend" as if it was based on the latest.
trans-unit.target: 我会使用rebase方法。主要是因为它在语义上完美地反映了你的情况,也就是说,你要做的是刷新你当前分支的状态,并 "假装 "好像它是基于最新的。

trans-unit.source: If I have a local branch from a remote one, I don't feel comfortable with merging other branches than this one with the remote. Also I would not push my changes, until I'm happy with what I want to push and also I wouldn't push things at all, that are only for me and my local repository. In your description it seems, that test is only for you? So no reason to publish it.
trans-unit.target: 如果我有一个来自远程分支机构的本地分支机构，那么除了将这个分支机构与远程分支机构合并之外，我不满意。同样，我不会推送更改，直到对要推送的内容感到满意并且也不会推送所有仅适用于我和我的本地存储库的东西。在您的描述中，似乎该 test 仅适合您？因此，没有理由发布它。

trans-unit.source: If conflict is encountered, we can run git status to check details about the conflicts and try to solve
trans-unit.target: 如果遇到冲突，我们可以运行 git status 来检查有关冲突的详细信息并尝试解决

trans-unit.source: If you're worried about breaking something on the merge, git merge --abort is there for you.
trans-unit.target: 如果您担心在合并中破坏某些内容，可以使用 git merge --abort 。

trans-unit.source: In git, what is the difference between merge --squash and rebase?
trans-unit.target: 在git中,merge --squash和rebase有什么区别?

trans-unit.source: It would "squeeze" all test commits into one merge commit on master; that is to say on master branch, we can't see the all change logs of test branch.
trans-unit.target: 它将把所有的测试提交 "挤压 "到一个主分支上的合并提交中,也就是说,在主分支上,我们无法看到测试分支的所有变更日志。

trans-unit.source: It's unsafe, because we don't know if there are any conflicts between test branch and master branch.
trans-unit.target: 这是不安全的,因为我们不知道测试分支和主分支之间是否有冲突。

trans-unit.source: Let's say work on test is taking several days and you want to continuously keep test updated with commits inside master.
trans-unit.target: 假设 test 工作需要花费几天的时间，并且您希望通过 master 内的提交来不断更新 test 。

trans-unit.source: Like
trans-unit.target: Like

trans-unit.source: Merging vs. Rebasing
trans-unit.target: 合并与重定价

trans-unit.source: My work on test is done and I am ready to merge it back to master. Here are the two ways I can think of:
trans-unit.target: 我的 test 工作已经完成，我准备将其合并回 master 。这是我可以想到的两种方法：

trans-unit.source: Neither a rebase nor a merge should overwrite anyone's changes (unless you choose to do so when resolving a conflict).
trans-unit.target: 无论是重构还是合并都不应该覆盖任何人的更改(除非你在解决冲突时选择这样做)。

trans-unit.source: Next choose a very good commit message and push to GitHub. Make the pull request then.
trans-unit.target: 接下来选择一个非常好的提交消息,然后推送到GitHub。然后进行拉取请求。

trans-unit.source: No need to check out first; rebase does the right thing with two arguments
trans-unit.target: 不需要先结账,Rebase用两个论点做对的事情。

trans-unit.source: Now make sure only the first is pick, the rest is s:
trans-unit.target: 现在确保只有第一个是 pick ，其余是 s ：

trans-unit.source: Now you could do:
trans-unit.target: 现在你可以做。

trans-unit.source: Of course, just fetching from origin does not refresh the local state of your master (as it does not perform a merge), but it is perfectly ok for our purpose - we want to avoid switching around, for the sake of saving time.
trans-unit.target: 当然，仅从原点获取不会刷新 master 的本地状态（因为它不执行合并），但这完全可以满足我们的目的-为了节省时间，我们希望避免切换。

trans-unit.source: Old thread, but I haven't found my way of doing it. It might be valuable for someone who works with rebase and wants to merge all the commits from a (feature) branch on top of master. If there is a conflict on the way, you can resolve them for every commit. You keep full control during the process and can abort any time.
trans-unit.target: 旧线程，但是我还没有找到解决方法。对于使用rebase并想要合并master上（功能）分支中的所有提交的某人来说，这可能是有价值的。如果途中存在冲突，则可以为每次提交解决它们。在此过程中，您可以完全控制，并且可以随时中止。

trans-unit.source: Once we solve the conflicts, or if there is no conflict, we commit and push them
trans-unit.target: 一旦解决了冲突，或者如果没有冲突，我们就会 commit 并 push 它们

trans-unit.source: So on GitHub, I end up doing the following for a feature branch mybranch:
trans-unit.target: 因此，在GitHub上，我最终对功能分支 mybranch 执行了以下操作：

trans-unit.source: So the best method is we have to use rebase instead of merge (suppose, when in this time, we have solved the branch conflicts).
trans-unit.target: 因此，最好的方法是我们必须使用 rebase 而不是 merge （假设，这时我们已经解决了分支冲突）。

trans-unit.source: So then you need to first resolve all your conflicts then, you have to again commit all your changes and then push
trans-unit.target: 那么,你需要先解决所有的矛盾,然后,你必须再次提交所有的修改,然后推送

trans-unit.source: So, when we suspect there would some conflicts, we can have following git operations:
trans-unit.target: 所以,当我们怀疑会有一些冲突时,我们可以进行下面的git操作。

trans-unit.source: So, without even checking out master, I would:
trans-unit.target: 因此，即使不签出 master ，我也会：

trans-unit.source: Test merge before commit, avoid a fast-forward commit by --no-ff,
trans-unit.target: commit 前测试 merge ，避免使用 --no-ff 快速提交，

trans-unit.source: The goal in all of this is to keep my test branch updated with the things happening in master and later I could merge them back into master hoping to keep the timeline as linear as possible.
trans-unit.target: 所有这一切的目的是使我的 test 分支与 master 中发生的事情保持更新，然后我可以将它们合并回 master 中,以希望时间线尽可能保持线性。

trans-unit.source: The only thing you need to avoid is: never use rebase on public branch, like master branch.
trans-unit.target: 您唯一需要避免的是：永远不要在公共分支（如master分支）上使用 rebase 。

trans-unit.source: The usual approach while developing is
trans-unit.target: 开发时通常采用的方法是

trans-unit.source: There are several developers who either commit to master or create other branches and later merge into master.
trans-unit.target: 有几个开发人员要么致力于 master 要么创建其他分支，然后合并成 master 。

trans-unit.source: This approach has two issues:
trans-unit.target: 这种方法有两个问题：

trans-unit.source: This is a very practical question, but all the answers above are not practical.
trans-unit.target: 这是个很实用的问题,但上面的答案都不实用。

trans-unit.source: This is better do who has done changes in test branch, because he knew what changes he has done.
trans-unit.target: 这是谁在测试分支中做过改动的比较好,因为他知道自己做了什么改动。

trans-unit.source: This is from GitLab: Just follow the instructions:
trans-unit.target: 这是来自GitLab。只需按照说明进行操作即可。

trans-unit.source: This is the workflow that I use at my job with the team. The scenario is as you described. First, when I'm done working on test I rebase with master to pull in whatever has been added to master during the time I've been working on the test branch.
trans-unit.target: 这是我在团队工作中使用的工作流程。情况如您所描述。首先，当我完成 test 工作时，我以master为基础进行基础工作，以提取我在 test 分支工作期间添加到master中的所有内容。

trans-unit.source: This will pull the changes to master since you forked the test branch and apply them, and then apply the changes you've made to test "on top of" the current state of master. There may be conflicts here, if the other people have made changes to the same files that you've edited in test. If there are, you will have to fix them manually, and commit. Once you've done that, you'll be good to switch to the master branch and merge test in with no problems.
trans-unit.target: 自从您分支 test 分支并应用它们以来，这会将更改拉到master上，然后将所做的更改应用到“在master的当前状态之上”进行测试。如果其他人对您在测试中编辑的相同文件进行了更改，则此处可能存在冲突。如果有，您将必须手动修复它们并提交。完成此操作后，最好切换到master分支并合并 test ，不会出现任何问题。

trans-unit.source: Usage:
trans-unit.target: Usage:

trans-unit.source: Using push and then pull as a means of merging is silly. I'm also not sure why you're pushing test to origin.
trans-unit.target: 用推送然后再拉的方式来合并是很傻的。我也不明白你为什么要把测试推到原点。

trans-unit.source: What is the best (and safest) way to merge a Git branch into master
trans-unit.target: 将Git分支合并到主站的最佳(也是最安全的)方法是什么?

trans-unit.source: When you're ready to merge back into master,
trans-unit.target: 当你准备合并回主子的时候。

trans-unit.source: With this option, 'merge-recursive' spends a little extra time to avoid mismerges that sometimes occur due to unimportant matching lines (e.g., braces from distinct functions). Use this when the branches to be merged have diverged wildly. See also git-diff[1] --patience.
trans-unit.target: 使用这个选项,'merge-recursive'可以花一点额外的时间来避免由于不重要的匹配行(例如,来自不同函数的括号)导致的错误合并。当要合并的分支之间的分歧很大时,可以使用这个方法。参见 git-diff[1]--patience。

trans-unit.source: Yep, when you have uppers done, all the Test branch's commits will be moved onto the head of Master branch. The major benefit of rebasing is that you get a linear and much cleaner project history.
trans-unit.target: 是的,当你完成了upper后,所有测试分支的提交都会被移到Master分支的头部。重命名的主要好处是,你会得到一个线性的、更干净的项目历史。

trans-unit.source: You have to have the branch checked out to pull, since pulling means merging into master, and you need a work tree to merge in.
trans-unit.target: 你必须要有支部检查出来才能拉,因为拉的意思是并入主,需要有工作树才能并入。

trans-unit.source: You might have made many commits in the other branch, which should only be one commit in the master branch. To keep the commit history as clean as possible, you might want to squash all your commits from the test branch into one commit in the master branch (see also: Git: To squash or not to squash?). Then you can also rewrite the commit message to something very expressive. Something that is easy to read and understand, without digging into the code.
trans-unit.target: 您可能在另一个分支中进行了多次提交，而这些提交只能是master分支中的一个提交。为了使提交历史记录尽可能整洁，您可能希望将所有来自test分支的提交压缩为master分支中的一个提交（另请参见：Git：压缩还是不压缩？）。然后，您也可以将提交消息重写为非常具有表现力的内容。无需深入了解代码即可轻松阅读和理解的内容。

trans-unit.source: and on GitHub
trans-unit.target: 和 GitHub 上

trans-unit.target: appendix:

trans-unit.source: edit: You might be interested in
trans-unit.target: 编辑:你可能会有兴趣

trans-unit.source: git always tries to respect yours and others changes, and so will --rebase. I don't think I can explain it appropriately, so have a look at the Git book - Rebasing or git-ready: Intro into rebasing for a little description. It's a quite cool feature
trans-unit.target: git总是尝试尊重您和他人的更改，-- --rebase 也是如此。我认为我无法适当地解释它，因此请参阅Git书-变基或git-ready：介绍变基以进行一些描述。这是一个很酷的功能

trans-unit.source: git push by default pushes all branches that exist here and on the remote
trans-unit.target: git push默认情况下会推送这里和远程的所有分支。

trans-unit.source: if you are not sure about rebasing operations, please refer to: https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Branching-Rebasing
trans-unit.target: 如果您不确定重新定基操作，请参阅：https : //git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Branching-Rebasing
